result.execSummary:
The defendant Ramon Saavedra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $1,238.95 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Fund, first priority.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No contact with the victim as specified in the complaint or Beartrice D., or their school, work, or residence. 
No social media accounts, but the Court will allow the defendant to maintain an email account.
Any email account and/or device with electronic communication capabilities must be made available to the department immediately upon request for inspection. 
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.

Complete a sex offender evaluation and any therapy, counseling, and/or treatment as deemed appropriate.
Register as a sex offender and comply with applicable sex offender rules and the rules of the Department of Corrections.
Provide a DNA sample.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Cash bail on deposit to be applied. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1,238.95 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Fund, first priority.
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA).
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.

Defendant Ramon Saavedra in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court had discussion with defense regarding immigration status. State placed prior negotiations on the record. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Herica S and Beatrice D.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 54 MONTHS with 24 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.


  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Complete a sex offender evaluation and any therapy, counseling, and/or treatment as deemed appropriate.
- No contact with the victim as specified in the complaint or Beartrice D., or their school, work, or residence. 
- No social media accounts, but the Court will allow the defendant to maintain an email account.
- Any email account and/or device with electronic communication capabilities must be made available to the department immediately upon request for inspection. 
- Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Register as a sex offender and comply with applicable sex offender rules and the rules of the Department of Corrections.
- Provide a DNA sample.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Cash bail on deposit to be applied. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
- Restitution in the amount of $1,238.95 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Fund, first priority.
- All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA).
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered the sentence to commence forthwith.
Sworn as interpreter: Alexandra Wirth.
Victim impact statement received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.`
Letters in support of the defendant received and filed.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court advised the defendant that upon a conviction of this offense he may be subject to Chapter 980 proceedings.
Court advised the defendant of the sex offender registry requirements.

Court vacted jury trial date of 5/26/15. Parties request an adjourned sentencing date. Court grants joint request for adjournment. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Ramon Saavedra in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Sworn as Interpreter: Ruth Garcia. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Third Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to sec., 940.225(3), 939.50(3)(g) Wis. Stats., a Class G Felony.

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended information and waived formal reading.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Parties advised the Court they have reached a resolution and request this be set on the calendar prior to the jury trial date. Case adjourned to 5/22/15 at 1:30 p.m. for a projected plea date in Branch 25. Clerk notified interpreter coordinator of the new court date. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Ramon Saavedra in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Sworn as Interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. Arguments heard as to the State's other acts motion. Court DENIED State's motion for reasons stated on the record. Parties are prepared to proceed to trial. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 5/26/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Ramon Saavedra in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Defendant Ramon Saavedra in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:John Mueller-MPD Officer.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Scheduling conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ramon Saavedra in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Defendant Ramon Saavedra in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case set for scheduling conference. Sworn as Interpreter: Vicki Bermudez. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defense moves to dismiss Counts 1, 2 & 3 for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
